column4: I have a Wacom tablet, and when I scroll, the window scrolls the wrong direction.
Turn it upside down :0
Hahahahaha... no.
Sorry couldn't resist
do you have wacom-tools installed?  My install was effortless.  Worked after making changes to xorg
Yeah, I installed it. But afterwards, the scroll was reversed
is it that way everywhere in the system or just in Gimp or something else?
Everywhere. Even media players turn the volume up when i scroll down and down when I scroll up.
did you uncomment out the line in xorg dealing with "ForceDevice" - Table PC Only?  Mine didn't work right until I did that.
No, I got rid of those lines completely.
put them back in.  You might want to sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg to get it done automatically.
Well I have a backup copy. I'll just copy them from there.
Try that, uncomment out those lines in the three Wacom sections then CTRL/ALT/Backspace to restart X then let me know what happened.
What does Ctrl-Alt-Backspace do, exactly? I know it restarts X, but it doesn't seem to do anything when I do it.
It mearly restarts the X server which is your graphical display.  It doesn't restart the whole machine.  Not quite like CTRL-ALT-Delete
Does it work now?
Nope. Oh, and I found out why Ctrl-Alt-BackSpace wasn't working - it was the wrong Ctrl and Alt.
accept the invite and we'll be able to share the xorg config files.
I don't think I can... I'm using Gaim.
ok.. xchat has that feature..  Do you know the address to Pastebin?
Yeah.
if I have the address I'll post me wacom section there so you can compair it to yours.  I'm running Dapper LTS
